work_experience.title: Data and AI Specialist, Center of Excellence Lead
details: Hired and managed a team of 2 data and AI specialists as part of a Center of Excellence.
Consulted on approaches for connecting data infrastructure to AI agents for creative ideation and business problem solving.

work_experience.title: Data and Social Science Consultant
details: Built statistical and machine learning models to predict memorability of brand experiences.
Conducted analysis of timesheet data to identify strategic investment opportunities within the organization.

work_experience.title: Data and Social Science Consultant
details: Analyzed global cultural trends to identify opportunities for innovative new marketing campaigns using survey data and text analysis methods.
Developed custom data-driven AI agents to support multi-modal creative ideation.

work_experience.title: Network Analysis Consultant
details: Analyzed multi-relational network data from Nigerian organizations to identify challenges and opportunities for health activities in different states.

work_experience.title: Intern, Washington Internship for Students of Engineering (WISE)
details: Performed interviews and archival research to investigate policy recommendations for USAID operating procedures.
Wrote paper “A System for Change : USAID Critical Process Improvements” for the WISE Journal of Public Policy.

work_experience.title: Intern, Computational Sensing and Satellite Systems
details: Programmed machine learning algorithms into embedded sensing platforms.
Developed embedded drivers to support satellite orienting software.
Architected digital data acquisition and processing platforms.

work_experience.title: University Researcher, Center for Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Systems
work_experience.company: Missouri University of Science and Technology
details: Studied potential of using EEG to control computer interfaces with thought.
Applied machine learning techniques and nonlinear system modeling.
Investigated related neuroscience to understand limitations and possibilities.

work_experience.title: University Researcher, NASA Reduced Gravity Student Flight Opportunities Program
work_experience.company: Missouri University of Science and Technology
details: Designed and tested zero-gravity experiment: Active Compression-Decompression CPR for Long Term Space Travel
Tested zero gravity experiment aboard NASA “Weightless Wonder” (aka “Vomit Comet”).
Used MATLAB to process sensor signal data and execute quantitative analysis.
Created outreach program affecting over one thousand students each year.

work_experience.title: Intern, Instrumentation Technologies
details: Performed data analysis and hardware instrument testing for research on earth penetrators.
Designed circuit boards for testing latency on low-voltage differential signaling systems.

work_experience.title: Intern, Ethernet Access Devices and Systems Engineering
details: Developed embedded software for Layer 2 Ethernet Access Devices using C and C++.
Designed database schemas and wrote server-side Objective C code for an internal website.

research_projects.title: Social Cohesion in the Fat Liberation Community on Twitter
details: Applied event history analysis with novel measures of interactions to identify types of behaviors that lead to increased social cohesion.
Developed novel approach to identifying community boundaries and associated sampling frames using social network analysis.

research_projects.title: Measuring Gender Stereotypes in 80 Years of American Print Media
details: Collaborated with sociologists to develop measures to capture changes in gender stereotypes latent in several thousands of print media articles.
Built database and data management infrastructure to support word embedding model training and analysis.

research_projects.title: Narrative Analysis of Austerity in UK Print Media
details: Developed novel approach to capture narrative as relationships between symbolic entities using network analysis and word embedding models.

research_projects.title: Within-party Discursive Influence on Twitter
details: Applied topic modeling and genetic algorithms to understand political discussions and influence in more than one million Tweets from 50 politicians.

awards_and_honors.organization: Networks in a Global World (NetGlo) Conference
awards_and_honors.project_title: Institutions, Cognition, and Discursive Fields in Colombian Politics
awards_and_honors.description: Examines the contributions of dual-process models to cultural and institutional analysis in the age of mass social media campaigns. Was not able to attend the conference.

awards_and_honors.organization: NSF Integrative Graduate Education and Research Traineeship Program (IGERT), University of California, Santa Barbara
awards_and_honors.project_title: Populist Culture and Discourse in the Colombian Peace Process
awards_and_honors.description: Grant was awarded to explore the ways that social media has fundamentally changed strategies of populist leaders in the aftermath of the October 2, 2016 peace referendum that was rejected by popular vote. Examines Colombian “political culture” in a broader sense using a unique combination of qualitative interviews, computational text analysis of politician Tweets, and survey analysis with quantitative methods for culture. Travelled to Colombia in Summer 2017 to conduct interviews with politicians and diplomats involved in the peace process.

awards_and_honors.organization: NSF Integrative Graduate Education and Research Traineeship Program (IGERT), University of California, Santa Barbara
awards_and_honors.description: Took courses and completed modules with an interdisciplinary focus on social, biological, and complex networks. Completed projects on quantitative belief networks, US News source comparison using word2vec, text analysis of National Security Strategy documents using word embedding algorithms, and social influence network evolution.
